name: Broadcast Coffee & Bakery
notes: Thanks to a partnership with Temple Pastries (a local Seattle bakery), their (very tasty) pastry selection is more diverse than most coffee shops.

name: Santo Coffee Co.
notes: Santo Coffee Co. was founded by former Sounders FC player, Fredy Montero. They specialize in Colombian coffee. Their coffee blend is one of the best I've had.

name: Armistice Coffee Roosevelt
address: 6717 Roosevelt Way NE Suite 101, Seattle, WA 98115
notes: Serves Turkish coffee, complete with traditional coffeeware. Sometimes they roast coffee in store, which smells delicious.

name: Espresso Vivace Capitol Hill
notes: A traditional Italian espresso bar founded in 1988, making it one of the oldest coffee shops in Seattle. Self-proclaimed as a charter to "research, develop and prepare caffe espresso as a new culinary art."

name: 203F Coffee Co.
address: 11901 NE Village Plaza Suite 171, Kirkland, WA 98034
notes: Cafe with a special emphasis on aesthetic, design and ambiance. Lattes and cappuccinos are some of the best I've had.

name: Fulcrum Cafe.
notes: Cafe with an emphasis on interior design. Feels like a blend of a showcase and a coffee shop. Coffee's alright.

name: Victorola Coffee Roasters
notes: A staple Seattle chain coffee shop and roaster. Occasionally hosts tastings at their Capitol Hill location.

name: Zoka Coffee Roaster & Tea Company
notes: A small Seattle chain with 4 locations. I personally consider it the standard for Seattle coffee.

name: Lighthouse Roasters
notes: Known more as a roaster than a cafe, but with a small neighborhood location. Great coffee, a few pastries, good for a quick stop.

name: Elm Coffee Roasters
notes: A coffee roaster will a minimal storefront. Most of the location is dedicated to roasting equipment, which is plainly visible from the tiny cafe area. Neat.

name: Mercury's Coffee Co.
notes: One of the largest Seattle chains with several locations, albeit all on the east side. Their Bellevue location has an unrivaled selection of pastries, all made in-house.

name: Third Culture Coffee
notes: A bombshell of a cafe. Specializes in coffee drinks from around the world, including Vietnamese Coffee, Lassi, French Drinking Chocolate, and more.

name: Distant Worlds Coffeehouse
notes: A sci-fi themed cafe, uniquely, with a large selection of board games.

name: Mr. West Cafe Bar
notes: Ultramodern cafe with a full bar and a full kitchen. Go if you want to feel fancy.

name: Cafe Allegro
address: Alleyway, 4214 University Wy NE, Seattle, WA 98105
notes: One of the oldest cafes in Seattle, opened in 1975. Quaint, classic, cozy, college-core. A must for UW students.

name: SEAFAB CAFE
notes: Got a parking ticket here once. Not a fan.

name: Anchorhead Coffee
address: CenturyLink Plaza, 1600 7th Ave Ste 105, Seattle, WA 98101
notes: Cafe with a sleek design aesthetic. It's alright.
